===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|七|tr1=shichi|t1=seven|五|tr2=go|t2=five|三|tr3=san|t3=three|lang=ja|sort=しちごさん}}. Literally ''[[seven]]-[[five]]-[[three]]'', referring to the ages of the children involved.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しちごさん}}

# The [[Japanese]] [[festival]] for [[children]]; a traditional [[rite of passage]] and festival day in Japan for three- and seven-year-old [[girl]]s and three- and five-year-old [[boy]]s, held annually on November 15. As Shichi Go San is not a national holiday, it is generally observed on the nearest weekend. Similar to {{l|ja|こどもの日|tr=''Kodomo no hi''|gloss=Childrens Day}}
